definition: to lose sth abstract but important (courage, authority, one's life etc)/to be bereaved of (one's spouse etc)/to die/disappointed/discouraged
in confusion or disorder/in a confused state of mind/disorder/upheaval/riot/illicit sexual relations/to throw into disorder/to mix up/indiscriminate/random/arbitrary
to deteriorate/to decline/to slump/also written 凌夷
change of dynasties/clear out the old, bring in the new
the people's livelihood is reduced to destitution (idiom); a time of famine and impoverishment
destitute and homeless (idiom); displaced and without means
An-Shi Rebellion (755-763) of 安祿山|安禄山[An1 Lu4 shan1] and 史思明[Shi3 Si1 ming2], a catastrophic setback for Tang dynasty
(of a country) to perish/to be annexed/subjugation (to a foreign power)
Han dynasty (206 BC-220 AD)/refers to the Western Han and Eastern Han
